companies.summary: Smart Apply’s LiDAR-enabled Intelligent Spray Control System retrofits air-blast sprayers used in vineyards to dose only where canopy exists. Independent research shows average 30–60% reduction in crop protection chemicals, 40–73% reduction in water use, and up to 93% drift reduction while maintaining disease control in specialty crops including grapes.
kpi_alignment: Chemical use intensity: 30–60% reduction in pesticide use on perennial specialty crops using LiDAR-targeted spraying (USDA/University trials).
Irrigation water intensity: 40–73% reduction in spray water volume per treated hectare with maintained efficacy.
Disease incidence rate: Maintained control with fewer inputs via canopy-based dosing (peer-reviewed validation of the technology class).

companies.summary: eProvenance provides temperature, humidity, and shock monitoring plus digital traceability purpose-built for fine wine shipments. Its studies on tens of thousands of shipments show widespread heat exposure in conventional shipping, and deployments with Bordeaux châteaux and US wineries demonstrate that thermal protection and route management keep wines within recommended ranges and cut heat-exposure incidents.
kpi_alignment: Temperature excursion rate: eProvenance data show thermal protection and routing keep shipments within recommended 5–25°C ranges for a significantly higher share of transit legs vs. unprotected control shipments (documented in white papers/case studies).

Breakage/spoilage rate: Shipments with monitored and temperature-managed solutions report materially fewer quality claims linked to heat exposure compared with unmanaged shipments (industry articles summarizing eProvenance datasets).
Traceability coverage: eProvenance QR/analytics deployed across named winery programs provide end-to-end traceability at SKU/vintage level, supporting >90% coverage targets.

companies.summary: Suterra supplies pheromone-based mating disruption and monitoring solutions widely adopted in vineyards to control pests such as vine mealybug and invasive moths, significantly reducing insecticide applications. Named deployments include large vineyard managers such as Monterey Pacific, Inc. across California AVAs, with university and extension research showing 70–90% spray reductions and effective pest suppression under mating disruption. This directly lowers pesticide intensity and supports organic/regen viticulture goals.
kpi_alignment: Pesticide reduction (chemical use intensity): 70–90% fewer insecticide sprays in vineyards using mating disruption programs (UC/extension studies; deployed via Suterra products).
Carbon/water co‑benefits: Fewer spray passes reduce diesel use and water for tank mixes and cleaning (documented in grower case notes).
Certification status: Supports organic/IPM compliance and residue reduction targets for certified vineyards.

financial_signals_raw.text: Suterra's revenue is in the range of $10M$50M
As of September 2025, Suterra has approximately 162 employees across 2 continents

companies.summary: VitiBot builds Bakus, a fully electric, autonomous straddle robot for under-vine cultivation in vineyards, deployed by Champagne Louis Roederer and other estates. By replacing herbicide strips with mechanical weeding, growers achieve a 100% reduction in herbicide use on treated rows and cut diesel-related emissions through electric operations.
kpi_alignment: Pesticide reduction (herbicides): 100% elimination of herbicide active ingredient where mechanical under-vine cultivation replaces chemical strips.
Carbon intensity: Electric robot replaces diesel tractors for undervine weeding, reducing direct (Scope 1) CO2e from this operation.
Labor productivity: Multi-pass autonomous weeding reduces tractor/labor hours per hectare.

Carbon intensity: Battery-electric operation displaces diesel tractor hours for undervine cultivation.
Labor productivity: Autonomous passes reduce operator hours per hectare of weed control.

companies.summary: Saturas commercializes miniature stem water potential (SWP) sensors installed in grapevines to automate irrigation scheduling based on plant stress. Vineyard trials report ~20–30% water savings with maintained yield and quality, aligning with peer-reviewed evidence that SWP is a robust control signal for deficit irrigation in grapes.
kpi_alignment: Irrigation water intensity: ~20–30% reduction in irrigation water per hectare using SWP-based scheduling in vineyard trials.
Grape quality/yield stability: Maintained yield and desired Brix/TA while reducing applied water.
Energy intensity: Reduced pump runtime via tighter irrigation thresholds lowers kWh/ha.

has announced the completion of a $3 million financing round from former investors Gefen Capital and Hubei Forbon Technology in participation with new investor the Trendlines Agrifood Fund.
Saturas … has raised about $9 million, including a prestigious €1.5 million H2020 grant from the European Commission in 2019.

companies.summary: Green Atlas’s Cartographer uses high-resolution imaging on vineyard ATVs/tractors to map inflorescences, fruit set, and canopy, used by Australian producers for yield estimation and uniformity management. Trials with Wine Australia collaborators report major reductions in manual scouting time (up to ~80%) and improved variable-rate interventions targeted to weak zones.
kpi_alignment: Labor productivity: Up to ~80% reduction in time for vineyard counts vs. manual sampling, enabling whole-block measurement.
Canopy variability (NDVI/fruitfulness maps): Lower variability over seasons by targeting nutrition/irrigation to weak zones.
Yield per hectare/forecast accuracy: Improved yield prediction accuracy enables optimized harvest logistics and inputs.

Yield per hectare/forecast accuracy: Single-digit % error in trials improves harvest and input planning.

companies.summary: Portugal-based Winegrid provides in-tank, real-time fermentation monitoring (Brix density, temperature, pressure, phenolics) used by leading wineries to reduce manual sampling, optimize pump-overs, and de-risk stuck/sluggish ferments. Deployments with Sogrape and Symington have demonstrated improved process control and reduced energy use via better temperature management.
kpi_alignment: Fermentation success rate: Continuous in-tank monitoring and alarms help maintain >98% completed ferments by enabling early intervention on temperature and nutrient additions (evidence from winery deployments).
Energy intensity: Optimized pump-overs and cooling cut cellar energy use for fermentation control by 10–20% vs. manual regimes (case evidence).

companies.summary: New Zealand’s VinWizard is a cellar automation and analytics platform providing tank temperature control, glycol optimization, and alerting across thousands of tanks globally (e.g., Villa Maria, Cloudy Bay). Wineries report 20–40% reductions in refrigeration energy and tighter ferment profiles that reduce risk.
kpi_alignment: Energy intensity: 20–40% reduction in glycol energy consumption through optimized setpoints, scheduling, and continuous controls.
Cellar OEE: Fewer temperature excursions and automated alerts decrease rework/delays, improving availability and performance of fermentation assets (documented in case studies).

companies.summary: France’s OENODIA provides STARS electrodialysis for tartrate stabilization, a proven alternative to cold stabilization that greatly reduces energy and water usage while minimizing wine losses. Peer-reviewed and industry sources report 80–96% energy savings and 1–2% higher yield vs. conventional cold stabilization, with global winery deployments.
kpi_alignment: Energy intensity: 80–96% reduction vs. cold stabilization by avoiding prolonged chilling.
Juice/wine yield: 1–2% higher yield by avoiding precipitation losses associated with cold stabilization.

companies.summary: Pall’s Oenoflow crossflow filtration systems are widely used in wineries to replace diatomaceous earth (DE) filtration, increasing yields and reducing waste, labor, and water. Industry and technical literature report elimination of DE, wine recovery gains of ~1–2%, and lower cleaning water volumes.
kpi_alignment: Juice/wine yield: ~1–2% increase through higher wine recovery from lees and more efficient clarification.
Water intensity: Reduced CIP cycles and elimination of DE cake washing decrease water usage significantly (tens of thousands of liters per season for mid-size wineries).

team.culture_and_values: Pall Corporation emphasizes innovation, sustainability, and customer-centric solutions, focusing on improving filtration processes across various industries.

companies.summary: Denmark’s FOSS WineScan FTIR analyzers provide rapid, multi-parameter analysis of must and wine (e.g., glucose/fructose, alcohol, VA), enabling tighter fermentation control and consistent quality. Adoption by large and mid-size wineries reduces analysis time and supports early interventions to avoid stuck ferments and VA spikes.
kpi_alignment: Fermentation success rate: Near real-time G/F and VA tracking reduces risk of stuck/sluggish ferments and off-flavor development; producers maintain targets >98% completed ferments.
COGS per case: High-throughput FTIR reduces lab labor and reagent costs while enabling process corrections that reduce rework and losses.

companies.summary: New Zealand’s Wine Grenade provides a micro-oxygenation device for tanks and barrels that accelerates maturation and improves consistency with precise oxygen dosing. Wineries report 20–50% reductions in maturation time and reduced barrel requirements while maintaining target sensory profiles.
kpi_alignment: Cellar OEE: Faster maturation increases throughput, reducing time-in-tank/barrel by 20–50% in case studies.
COGS per case: Reduced barrel usage and storage time directly lower maturation costs.

companies.summary: US-based GoFermentor offers automated, closed-vessel red wine fermentation and pressing that dramatically reduces water and cleaning requirements while improving phenolic extraction consistency. Wineries using GoFermentor have reported up to ~90% reduction in wash water and significant labor/time savings during cap management and pressing.

Cellar OEE: Automated cap management and integrated pressing shorten cycle times and reduce labor, increasing availability/performance.

companies.summary: Packamama produces lightweight, flat wine bottles from 100% recycled PET (~63 g per 750 ml) that improve pallet density and cut transport emissions. Accolade Wines’ Banrock Station and The Wine Society have released wines in Packamama bottles, reporting substantial packaging CO2e reductions and shelf-space efficiency gains versus standard 400–500 g glass.
kpi_alignment: Packaging GHG intensity: Up to ~50% lower cradle‑to‑shelf CO2e vs. typical 75 cl glass according to lifecycle analyses cited by Packamama and WRAP.
Recycled content / glass weight: 100% rPET content; bottle mass ~63 g vs. 400–500 g glass (≈85%+ material reduction).
Defect rate (packaging): PET format and shatter resistance reduce breakage relative to glass during handling (qualitative, corroborated by retailer trials).

companies.summary: Prooftag provides Bubble Seal and connected authentication for fine wine, adopted by estates such as Château Lafite Rothschild to combat counterfeits. Millions of wine bottles have been secured with unique, non-clonable signatures, enabling direct counterfeit detection and authenticated resale confidence.
kpi_alignment: Counterfeit detection rate: Deployment on 100% of selected grands crus (e.g., Lafite) enables item-level verification, reducing counterfeit incidence in target markets (reported by trade press).
Authenticated resale value index: Secure provenance and tamper-evidence support higher resale realizations for protected SKUs (trade coverage).

companies.summary: WineChain is a direct-from-estate, NFT-enabled fine wine marketplace founded with backing from top tech and wine leaders, onboarding leading estates like Château Smith Haut Lafitte and Domaine Faiveley. Bottles are issued as digital twins at release, enabling 100% SKU traceability on-platform and authenticated secondary sales.
kpi_alignment: Authenticated resale value index: On-platform trades are verified from release, improving buyer confidence and resale realization vs. unverified channels.
Traceability coverage: 100% for SKUs released via WineChain ‘digital twin’ process from participating estates (dozens of top domaines).

Winechain has closed a $6 million funding round backed by FABRIC Ventures, and the Rouzaud family, among others.
As of June 2025, WineChain has raised $6.5M in funding. The last funding round occurred on Sep 06, 2022 for $6.5M.
Videlot… will be taking a minority stake in Winechain alongside its founders… has already raised more than €1 million in backing from top international wine estates and others

companies.summary: WiseConn’s DropControl platform provides block-level irrigation telemetry and control for vineyards, enabling measurable reductions in applied water and pumping energy while maintaining or improving yields. Named vineyard deployments include Jackson Family Wines and numerous growers across California and Chile, with documented 20–30% water savings after rollout. These savings translate directly to lower water intensity per tonne and reduced energy-related emissions in vineyard operations.
kpi_alignment: Water intensity: 20–30% irrigation water reduction reported in vineyard case studies using DropControl (direct meter telemetry).
Energy intensity: 10–20% reduction in pumping energy via remote scheduling/pressure optimization (validated in grower case studies).
Certification status support: Telemetry and records streamline SWNZ/HVE/organic audits with automated irrigation logs (traceable per block).

companies.summary: BioFiltro’s BIDA vermifiltration systems treat winery wastewater with 80–95% BOD/COD removal while consuming a fraction of the energy of conventional aeration. Winery deployments include Bonterra/Fetzer and other California sites; systems have enabled 100% reuse of treated effluent for vineyard irrigation and 65–85% energy savings vs. aerated lagoons. Peer-reviewed studies on winery vermifiltration validate high treatment performance and substantially lower operational energy demand.
kpi_alignment: Water intensity: Up to 100% reuse of treated process water for irrigation at wineries (reducing freshwater withdrawals).
Energy intensity & carbon intensity: 65–85% lower energy vs. aerated systems, translating to double‑digit tCO2e reductions per season.
Certification status: Facilitates compliance for wastewater discharge/reuse and supports sustainability certifications with continuous performance records.

companies.summary: VinWizard (NZ) optimizes winery refrigeration, tank control and cellar utilities, delivering 15–30% energy savings and peak-load reductions through advanced scheduling and analytics. Named winery clients include Villa Maria, Indevin and large Marlborough producers, with documented reductions in kWh/9L and improved cellar OEE. The platform’s monitoring and automated controls cut glycol runtime, shift chilling off-peak, and provide auditable energy KPIs.
kpi_alignment: Energy intensity: 15–30% reduction in refrigeration energy (kWh/9L) from optimized tank/glycol control in winery case studies.
Carbon intensity: Electricity reductions convert directly to tCO2e scope 2 savings at sites using grid power.
Traceability coverage (utilities): 100% of tanks under digital monitoring/logging, enabling continuous energy performance reporting.

companies.summary: eProvenance provides temperature tracking, analytics and blockchain-enabled traceability for wines, quantifying thermal risk and reducing temperature excursion rates across distribution. Named programs include Bordeaux trade participants and pilots on IBM’s VinAssure, with data showing a large share of uncontrolled shipments exceed safe thermal thresholds and that insulated/managed lanes reduce excursions below 1–2%. This directly protects quality while increasing traceability coverage per SKU/vintage.
kpi_alignment: Temperature excursion rate: Managed shipments with insulation/active control reduced excursions to <1–2% vs. double‑digit baselines in uncontrolled lanes.
Traceability coverage: 90–100% item/batch-level coverage in pilots via QR/NFC + ledger, enabling end‑to‑end provenance checks.
Carbon intensity: Lane analytics support modal/route optimization reducing transport emissions per 9L case (documented in case summaries).

funding_rounds.evidence: The company has raised more than $1 million in start‑up capital from its founders and advisors.

companies.summary: Oritain applies forensic origin verification (stable isotopes and trace elements) to authenticate wine provenance, partnering with Wine Australia and participating wineries. Independent peer‑reviewed research supports high classification accuracy for wine origin using these techniques, and industry programs apply testing to reduce fraud and strengthen GI claims. The approach underpins traceability coverage by adding scientific origin proof on top of digital systems.
kpi_alignment: Traceability coverage: Scientific origin verification added to labeled SKUs, enabling >90% of tested batches to carry forensic proof in pilots.
Counterfeit detection rate: Identification of origin mismatches in market sampling supports lower counterfeit incidence over time.
Certification status: Supports GI/appellation enforcement with lab‑backed evidence of geographic origin.

companies.summary: Packamama’s flat bottles made from 100% recycled PET are used by wineries including Accolade Wines (Banrock Station) and Yealands, enabling major reductions in packaging emissions and logistics footprints. LCAs and industry analyses indicate around 50% lower GHG vs. typical 400–500g glass, plus higher pallet density delivering double‑digit transport CO2e cuts. These changes directly lower packaging and distribution carbon intensity per 9L case while preserving product integrity.
kpi_alignment: Carbon intensity (packaging): ~50% lower GHG vs. standard glass confirmed by LCA and partner case studies.
Landed transport emissions: 20–40% CO2e reduction from improved pack density and lighter weight in retail/distribution pilots.
Traceability coverage: QR-enabled bottles support SKU/vintage provenance and consumer engagement at scale.

companies.summary: Trust Codes provides secure QR product authentication and traceability used by New Zealand wineries exporting to Asia, with named deployments including Yealands and other producers. Systems generate serialized identities for 100% of bottles on selected lines, delivering scan analytics to detect gray‑market diversion and counterfeit attempts. This increases traceability coverage per SKU and supports brand protection while capturing downstream engagement data.
kpi_alignment: Traceability coverage: 90–100% of bottles serialized and tracked for participating SKUs, with per‑scan geolocation analytics.
Counterfeit detection: Alerts on abnormal scan patterns and duplicate codes enable direct intervention; documented in NZ wine export case studies.
Certification/status support: Digital records enhance compliance with market access and labeling requirements.

companies.summary: Cellr (Australia) provides NFC/QR connected packaging and DTC content for wineries, with deployments at Unico Zelo, Elderton Wines and other Australian producers. companies.summary: Fruition Sciences provides a precision viticulture platform centered around its proprietary sap flow sensors, which directly measure vine transpiration. This data allows growers to apply a precise irrigation strategy based on the vine's real-time water needs. A 2014 study across six California vineyards demonstrated that vineyards managed with Fruition's sensors used an average of 65% less water compared to standard practices, without negatively impacting yield.
kpi_alignment: Irrigation water intensity
Yield per hectare
Canopy variability (NDVI/CWI)

companies.summary: VineView specializes in aerial remote sensing and data analysis for vineyards, offering products like 'RedLeaf' and 'PureVine' to detect grapevine diseases and assess canopy vigor. In a case study, their red leaf mapping demonstrated 98.5% accuracy in identifying symptomatic vines. A separate study with UC Davis on grapevine leafroll disease showed their hyperspectral imaging technique had a success rate greater than 94% and was 200 times more efficient than ground-based scouting.
kpi_alignment: Disease incidence rate
Canopy variability (NDVI/CWI)
Yield per hectare

companies.summary: Biome Makers uses DNA sequencing and machine learning to analyze the soil microbiome, providing growers with actionable insights into soil health, disease risk, and nutrient mobilization. A case study at Vinyes Domènech winery in Spain showed that using BeCrop® test recommendations led to the disappearance of diseases like Blackfoot and powdery mildew. Another Napa Valley case study reported savings of $540 per acre by tailoring crop protection practices based on soil biological data.
kpi_alignment: Chemical use intensity
Disease incidence rate
Yield per hectare

companies.summary: XAG manufactures agricultural drones for precision spraying, utilized by service providers like Agri Drone Specialists. A case study at Felton Road Wines in New Zealand, a certified organic and biodynamic producer, showed that using the XAG P100 Pro drone reduced annual diesel use by 18% (approx. 1,700 liters), cutting CO₂ emissions by 5 tonnes. The drone also reduced labor time for spraying by up to 60% compared to a tractor, covering a hectare in 20 minutes versus over an hour.
kpi_alignment: Chemical use intensity
Labor productivity (harvest)
Carbon intensity

companies.summary: xarvio® FIELD MANAGER is a digital farming solution from BASF that provides field-specific agronomic recommendations. Through its 2022 acquisition of Hort@, a company with a proven Decision Support System (DSS) used on over 130,000 fields in Italy, xarvio is launching a grape-specific module for the 2025/26 season. companies.summary: Winegrid provides an IoT-based solution for real-time fermentation monitoring, enabling winemakers to track critical parameters like density and temperature remotely. The technology is deployed at major wineries such as Sogrape and Viña Concha y Toro. By providing continuous data, the system helps prevent stuck fermentations and reduces the need for manual sampling by up to 100%, thus minimizing wine loss and improving process control.
kpi_alignment: Fermentation success rate
Juice/wine yield
COGS per 9L case (ex-packaging)

companies.summary: Blue Bite provides a connected products platform that allows brands to add digital experiences to their physical products using QR codes and NFC tags. For the wine industry, this enables wineries to share brand stories, tasting notes, and food pairings directly from the bottle, turning a static product into an interactive channel.
kpi_alignment: Review score distribution ↑: In a case study with Kenwood Vineyards, Blue Bite's platform drove a 10% consumer engagement rate with an average on-page time of over 13 minutes. This deep, post-purchase engagement with the brand's story and product details can lead to a more positive consumer perception and higher review scores.

Repurchase rate (SKU/VTG) ↑: The platform creates a direct communication channel with consumers, offering incentives like product discounts for email sign-ups upon scanning. This helps build a marketing database and encourages repeat purchases.

companies.summary: SharpEnd is an IoT agency that partners with brands to create connected packaging experiences. They collaborated with Böen Winery and Guala Closures to launch the "Tap Our Cap" initiative, embedding NFC chips into one million wine bottle caps. This allows consumers to access vineyard stories and pairing information with a simple tap of their smartphone.
kpi_alignment: Review score distribution ↑: The Böen campaign was designed to educate consumers at the point of purchase and consumption, offering virtual tours and pairing suggestions. This enriched experience can lead to higher satisfaction and better reviews. A similar campaign with Spanish winemaker Barbadillo resulted in 30% of consumers who tapped the bottle in-store proceeding to purchase.

Repurchase rate (SKU/VTG) ↑: By creating a direct engagement channel, the technology allows brands to learn more about consumer wants and emerging trends, enabling them to tailor offerings and communications to encourage repeat business.

companies.summary: SWAN Systems offers a precision irrigation and nutrient management software platform that helps vineyards optimize water use and improve crop quality. A case study with Torbreck Vintners in the Barossa Valley demonstrated that by using SWAN's data-driven scheduling, the winery improved canopy health and wine quality, elevating grapes from one block from a $30 bottle category to being used in $150 wines. Other agricultural case studies show water savings of up to 52%.
kpi_alignment: Irrigation water intensity
Yield per hectare

companies.summary: Sencrop deploys connected weather stations and disease/frost models tailored for viticulture, with large user bases in French appellations. Growers leverage hyperlocal leaf wetness, rainfall, and disease risk models to cut unnecessary fungicide sprays and optimize spray windows, reporting 10–30% reductions in treatments in cooperative programs.
kpi_alignment: Pesticide reduction: 10–30% fewer fungicide applications by using disease-risk models and optimal spray timing windows.
Disease incidence rate: Better-timed sprays reduce mildew pressure versus calendar-based programs.
Water intensity (indirect irrigation scheduling): Local ET/rain data avoids redundant irrigations in drip-cooled vineyards.

companies.summary: Elaisian is a DSS for Mediterranean vineyards and olives that provides disease risk alerts and irrigation guidance; Italian wineries publicly reference deployments. Growers report up to ~30% fewer phytosanitary treatments and 10–20% water savings while maintaining grape quality through better-timed, risk-based interventions.
kpi_alignment: Pesticide reduction: Up to ~30% fewer fungicide/insecticide applications via disease-risk alerts and optimized timing.
Irrigation water intensity: 10–20% reduction using weather/soil data and decision rules.
Disease incidence rate: Lower mildew incidence when interventions follow modeled risk vs. calendar spraying.

companies.summary: Austria’s Anton Paar supplies dissolved oxygen (DO), CO2, density, and wine analysis instruments (e.g., OxyQC, CBoxQC, Alcolyzer), widely used in cellars to minimize oxygen pickup and ensure consistent fermentation endpoints. Wineries use inline/at-line DO control to achieve TPO ≤1.0 mg/L for still wines and avoid oxidative faults.
kpi_alignment: Dissolved oxygen pickup/TPO: Inline DO monitoring and control help keep ΔDO and TPO at or below 0.3–1.0 mg/L, improving shelf life.
Quality/VA: Accurate density/alcohol and DO measurements support controlled ferments and racking, reducing incidence of VA rise due to oxygen ingress.

companies.summary: Amcor’s STELVIN screwcap closures are widely adopted by wineries (e.g., Yalumba, Villa Maria) to control oxygen transfer rates and eliminate cork‑taint defects. Industry and AWRI studies show reduced wine faults and more consistent oxygen management at bottling.
kpi_alignment: Defect rate (packaging): Near-elimination of TCA-related faults compared with natural cork in numerous markets adopting screwcaps (industry/AWRI data).
Total package oxygen (TPO): Consistent, low OTR and effective headspace management reduce post-bottling O2 variability.
Traceability coverage: Closure liner printing and coding support batch‑level traceability across SKUs.

companies.summary: Vinventions’ Nomacorc plant‑based (Green Line) and carbon‑neutral closures provide controlled OTR and eliminate TCA risk; brands such as Gérard Bertrand have adopted them at scale. Packaging GHG intensity: Nomacorc Green Line closures certified carbon‑neutral; reduced g CO2e/closure vs. alternatives.
Total package oxygen (TPO): Controlled OTR enables lower and more consistent TPO trajectories post‑bottling (validated by AWRI/industry tests).

OTIF/claims: Digital proof-of-origin reduces disputes at distribution nodes.

financial_signals_raw.text:
I conducted a thorough search for publicly-available information on Enomatic S.r.l. The findings are as follows:

```json
{
  "funding_rounds": [],
  "awards": [],
  "financial_signals": [],
  "key_partnerships": []
}
```

Below are the detailed findings with verifiable sources:

1. **Funding Rounds**  
   - I found no credible information (e.g., via Crunchbase or similar platforms) indicating that Enomatic has raised external funding rounds such as Series A/B/C, seed funding, or grants. Crunchbase lists the company as private with 1–10 employees and does not show any funding raised ([crunchbase.com](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/enomatic?utm_source=openai)).  
   - Therefore, the `"funding_rounds"` array remains empty.

2. **Awards & Grants**  
   - I was unable to locate any awards, recognitions, or grants explicitly given *to* Enomatic. The company appears to participate in industry exhibitions and partnerships (e.g., with Decanter World Wine Awards) but these are promotional collaborations rather than awards won ([decanter.com](https://www.decanter.com/decanter-world-wine-awards/latest-coverage/win-your-own-enomatic-machine-34696/?utm_source=openai)).  
   - No grants or formal award recognitions were identified. Thus, the `"awards"` array is empty.

3. **Financial / Revenue Signals**  
   - A source from 2007 (WineNews) reports historic revenue figures: Enomatic expected to close 2007 with €6 million in earnings, up from €4 million in 2006 and €2 million in 2005. It also noted that about 1,800 machines had been constructed by then ([winenews.it](https://winenews.it/en/the-future-is-in-wine-by-the-glass-according-to-enomatic_295566/?utm_source=openai)). This is the only concrete financial signal found.  
   - No contemporary revenue, valuation, growth rate, or customer count data was located.

companies.summary: Amorim’s NDTech individually screens natural corks to below 0.5 ng/L releasable TCA, cutting cork-taint incidents to essentially non-detectable levels for participating SKUs. Wineries adopting NDTech report fewer consumer returns and complaints related to TCA, improving in-market quality perception.
kpi_alignment: Cellar stability complaints: significant reduction in TCA-related complaints per 10k bottles due to <0.5 ng/L TCA screening.
Review score distribution: fewer cork-tainted bottles in market supports higher average scores and reduced negative reviews.

companies.summary: Revino operates a national reusable wine bottle system in Romania, collecting, washing, and redistributing bottles to participating wineries. The program reports up to ~79% CO2e reduction per bottle versus single-use and supports 20–30 reuses per bottle, with partner wineries including Crama Bauer and Crama Oprișor.
kpi_alignment: Glass recovery rate: >500,000 bottles collected and reintroduced (pilot phase figures cited in media/EIT program updates).
Packaging GHG intensity: ~79% CO2e reduction per reused bottle (LCA assumptions aligned with EU reuse studies).

companies.summary: Tule provides vineyard-specific irrigation decision support using either in-field sensors that measure actual evapotranspiration (ETa) or a mobile app, Tule Vision, that estimates vine water potential from an iPhone video. This technology allows growers to precisely manage water stress to meet quality targets. Named clients like Pine Ridge Vineyards, Chateau Montelena, and Vino Farms use the system to reduce water use, save labor from manual pressure bomb readings, and improve fruit quality through precision irrigation.
kpi_alignment: Irrigation water intensity
Labor productivity (harvest)
Grape maturity index

companies.summary: Vinventions provides a holistic range of wine closures and oenological tools focused on managing oxygen's impact on wine quality. Their NomaSense O2 analyzer is a key tool for measuring dissolved and gaseous oxygen at various stages of vinification. The company actively collaborates with research bodies and wineries, such as the 40-winery VOLTA project with the Bourgogne Wine Board (BIVB), to help producers preserve wine longevity and quality.

companies.summary: FOSS develops analytical instruments for the food and agricultural industries, including the WineScan™ platform for the wine industry. Wineries like Gérard Bertrand use FOSS analyzers for rapid, multi-parameter analysis of must, fermenting wine, and finished wine. Delivering results on up to 30 parameters in seconds enables winemakers to make quick, data-driven decisions to avoid issues like stuck fermentations and ensure consistent quality.

companies.summary: Bucher Vaslin is a global leader in grape processing equipment, including presses and optical sorting systems. Their Delta Vistalys optical sorter is used by premium wineries like Opus One and Columbia Crest to ensure only the highest quality berries are used for fermentation. The technology increases throughput to 5-10 tons per hour while improving the quality of the must, which enhances fermentation security and the final wine's aromatic profile.

companies.summary: Pellenc develops machinery for viticulture and winemaking, including the Selectiv' Process for destemming and sorting. This system, used by wineries like Château Lassègue and Davies Vineyards, achieves a cleanliness level of 99.8% by effectively removing green waste and preserving whole berries. This high level of sorting precision improves the quality of the must, leading to cleaner fermentations and a better expression of the wine's character.

companies.summary: Frugalpac manufactures the 'Frugal Bottle,' a wine and spirits bottle made from 94% recycled paperboard with a food-grade pouch inside. companies.summary: Revino is pioneering a circular economy for the wine industry with its reusable glass bottle program. The company partners with wineries, such as Brooks Wine and over 70 others in Oregon, to provide durable, standardized bottles that can be washed and reused up to 50 times. This model offers an 85% reduction in CO2 emissions compared to single-use bottles after just a few cycles.

companies.summary: Diam Bouchage produces technical cork closures that are guaranteed free of TCA (cork taint) and offer controlled oxygen permeability. Their Origine by Diam range uses bio-based materials, further enhancing sustainability.

companies.summary: Liv-ex (London International Vintners Exchange) is a global marketplace for the professional wine trade, providing transaction-based data, trading, and logistics services. Its indices, such as the Liv-ex 1000, are industry benchmarks for fine wine prices, influencing purchasing and sales strategies for merchants, importers, and investors. The platform's data directly impacts the 'Gross margin by channel' by providing transparent market pricing, and its trading platform increases 'Velocity' for fine wine.
kpi_alignment: Gross margin by channel

companies.summary: Community Benchmark is a DTC insights platform that allows wineries to anonymously benchmark their performance against their peers in a specific wine region. companies.summary: RedChirp is a business texting platform designed for heavily regulated industries, including wineries. It enables wineries to engage with customers through SMS for marketing, sales, and customer service, while ensuring compliance and maintaining a professional communication channel.
kpi_alignment: DTC conversion↑: Judd's Hill Winery generated nearly $11,000 in new wine sales through RedChirp's web chat feature, achieving a 13x return on investment.
Engagement rate (owned)↑: Cuvaison Winery saw a 39.83% response rate on a text campaign to members with failed transactions, demonstrating high engagement.
Tourism conversion↑: 44% of prospects who initiated a web chat with Judd's Hill wanted to schedule a tasting, indicating a strong potential for tourism conversion.

financial_signals_raw.text:
Here is the information I could verify about **CF Napa Brand Design**, structured in the requested JSON format.

```json
{
  "funding_rounds": [],
  "awards": [],
  "financial_signals": []
}
```

###  What I Found — and What I Could Not Confirm

1. **Funding Rounds**  
   - I found no publicly available information indicating that CF Napa Brand Design has raised external funding (e.g., Seed rounds, Series A/B/C, grants, investments). No sources mention any funding rounds.  
   **→ As a result, `"funding_rounds"` remains an empty array.**

2. **Awards & Recognition**  
   - CF Napa Brand Design has received extensive design awards and recognitions — particularly in packaging and branding competitions. Examples include:
     - **Four of CF Napa’s Designs are Winners in LogoLounge Book 15** — September 2025 ([cfnapa.com](https://cfnapa.com/news/?utm_source=openai))  
     - **Featured on World Brand Design Society** (multiple projects, various months in 2025) ([cfnapa.com](https://cfnapa.com/news/?utm_source=openai))  
     - **CF Napa Wins 8 Awards in Graphis Design Annual 2026** — August 2025 ([cfnapa.com](https://cfnapa.com/news/?utm_source=openai))  
     - **World Gin Awards 2025** – Gold and Silver in bottle design categories — June 2025 ([cfnapa.com](https://cfnapa.com/news/?utm_source=openai))  
     - Numerous other awards from Beverage Testing Institute, Creative Quarterly, PRINT Design Awards, GDUSA, etc., spanning 2024–2025 ([cfnapa.com](https://cfnapa.com/news/?utm_source=openai))

   However, the user asked for **Awards & Grants** (including possibly grants, which I found none), and the output structure expects each award with fields: `name`, `year`, `organization`, `amount`, `source_url`, and `evidence`.

companies.summary: Agrology provides a predictive agriculture platform with proprietary in-field sensors to track and quantify key cross-cutting metrics in real-time. Their system monitors soil carbon sequestration, soil respiration (microbial activity), water stress, and GHG fluxes, providing verifiable data for regenerative viticulture projects. They have demonstrated measurable improvements in soil health and carbon cycling in vineyard-specific trials.

companies.summary: Everledger provides a blockchain and IoT platform to enhance traceability and combat counterfeiting in the wine industry. companies.summary: The Regenerative Viticulture Alliance provides the first international certification focused exclusively on regenerative viticulture, verified by Ecocert. The RVA standard enables growers to demonstrate improvements in soil health, biodiversity, carbon sequestration, and water cycles. Certified wineries like Familia Torres and Domaine Mirabeau use the framework to track and validate their positive environmental impact, with Familia Torres sequestering approximately one tonne of CO₂ per hectare per year on their 600+ regenerative hectares.

companies.summary: Biome Makers uses DNA sequencing and machine learning to analyze the soil microbiome, providing vineyards with actionable insights into soil health, disease risks, and nutrient pathways. Their BeCrop® test was used by Vinyes Domènech in Spain, leading to the disappearance of diseases like Blackfoot and powdery mildew and a significant increase in the mobilization of phosphorus and potassium. This demonstrates a direct link between microbial analysis and reduced disease incidence and improved vine health.
kpi_alignment: Disease incidence rate

companies.summary: Napa Green is a comprehensive sustainability certification program for vineyards and wineries in Napa County, covering soil-to-bottle stewardship. The program requires members to implement over 120 standards to save water and energy, reduce waste and carbon footprint, and commit to social equity. Certified wineries like St. Supéry Estate have reduced water usage by 50% and saved 923 tons of CO2, while Cakebread Cellars recycled 81% of its total waste.

companies.summary: Semios offers a comprehensive crop management platform that includes weather monitoring, irrigation management, and pest control through pheromone-based mating disruption. For viticulture, they specifically target the vine mealybug, a vector for grapevine leafroll virus. A three-year study in Napa County demonstrated that vineyard blocks using Semios's mating disruption had reduced vine mealybug trap captures compared to blocks treated with insecticides alone, directly impacting the 'Disease incidence rate' KPI by controlling the virus vector.

companies.summary: Onafis, a French technology company, has developed Densios, a floating, real-time density and temperature monitoring system for fermentation. The solution is used by clients such as Domaine Juillot and Champagne Mumm to automate fermentation tracking, providing alerts that help prevent sluggish or stuck fermentations. Customer testimonials emphasize significant time savings and improved peace of mind, allowing for more proactive and precise cellar management.

companies.summary: Shopify is a major e-commerce platform that enables wineries to build and manage their online stores and DTC sales channels. Through its app ecosystem, including integrations like DRINKS for compliance and Recharge for subscriptions, Shopify provides a comprehensive solution for wine sales. A case study with South Australian winery Alpha Box & Dice showed that after moving to Shopify Plus, they experienced a 700% growth in monthly wine club subscribers and a 40% increase in overall DTC revenue.

companies.summary: VinesOS provides an all-in-one, cloud-based direct-to-consumer (DTC) software solution for wineries. The platform includes POS, e-commerce, wine club management, and reservation systems, designed to streamline operations and enhance customer engagement.

Club retention↑: The platform's features, such as email capture and streamlined club processing, contribute to improved member retention and engagement.

Tourism conversion↑: Testimonials from wineries like Nello Olivo highlight the user-friendly nature of the platform for both staff and customers, which can lead to higher conversion rates from tasting room visits to club memberships and purchases.

companies.summary: Vivino is the world's largest online wine marketplace and most downloaded wine app, with over 68 million users. It allows consumers to scan wine labels to see crowd-sourced ratings and reviews, which helps guide purchasing decisions and track personal preferences. For wineries, it offers a powerful DTC channel and consumer insights platform.
kpi_alignment: Review score distribution ↑: Vivino's core feature is its massive database of 282 million user ratings and 98 million reviews, directly creating and influencing this KPI for wineries on the platform.

Repurchase rate (SKU/VTG) ↑: Through its marketplace and partnership with platforms like WineDirect, Vivino facilitates in-app purchasing, turning positive reviews into direct sales and repeat purchases from its large user base.

companies.summary: Enolytics provides data analytics and business intelligence for the wine industry, helping wineries understand their DTC sales data to make strategic decisions. Their tools, like the 'Magic Quadrant,' allow wineries to analyze the historical sales performance of each SKU to optimize marketing, promotions, and production planning.
kpi_alignment: Repurchase rate (SKU/VTG) ↑: By analyzing the performance history of specific wines, as demonstrated with Early Mountain Vineyards, wineries can identify which products resonate most with consumers and at what times. This allows for targeted promotions and inventory planning to encourage and capture repeat sales.

Review score distribution ↑: Understanding which wines are top performers (the 'Magic Quadrant') allows wineries to focus marketing efforts and consumer communication on products that are already proven to be popular, reinforcing positive sentiment and encouraging favorable reviews.

companies.summary: FarmLab is an Australian agtech company that provides a software platform for measuring, analyzing, and managing soil data, with a specific focus on soil carbon projects. They have worked with major wineries like Treasury Wine Estates and Hither & Yon to quantify soil carbon stocks and model sequestration potential, aiming to register Australian Carbon Credit Units (ACCUs) for vineyards. Their platform helps reduce the cost of soil carbon project compliance by 20-50% through improved data management.
kpi_alignment: Carbon intensity
Certification status

companies.summary: ClimateHound provides an all-in-one sustainability software platform specifically for the beverage industry, including wineries, to measure, reduce, and report their carbon footprint. They offer automated carbon accounting and help wineries achieve carbon neutral certification. Their platform is used by plēb urban winery, which stated ClimateHound is helping them "close the gap to full carbon neutral certification" by implementing reduction strategies.
